com.layers.app.controller

Class GlobalExceptionController

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.layers.app.controller.GlobalExceptionController

  • @ControllerAdvice
 @SessionAttributes(value={"userToken","locationToken","requestToken"})
public class GlobalExceptionController
extends java.lang.Object
    Global exception controller that catches all unchecked exceptions. Each exception handler logs the exception and the user it was executed by. A proper message is assembled for the user to get a gist of the issue.
    See Also:
    ILogger

    • Method Detail

      • handleDatabaseException

        @ExceptionHandler(value=DatabaseException.class)
public org.springframework.web.servlet.ModelAndView handleDatabaseException(java.lang.Exception e,
                                                                                                                              org.springframework.ui.ModelMap model)

        500 Status Errors

        Catches DatabaseExceptions and assembles an error page to report internal server side issues. During development, devs may want to print out the proper message to the view to get details on the issue, otherwise they'll be met with a generic response.

        -- example of using exception message:

        ModelAndView mv = new ModelAndView("error");
 mv.addObject("error", e.getMessage());
  // mv.addObject("error", "Other text");
 return mv;
        Parameters:
        e - The throwable exception clause to extract details on the exception thrown
        model - Used to get user session model map
        Returns:
        error.jsp

      • handleNoHandlerFoundException

        @ExceptionHandler(value=org.springframework.web.servlet.NoHandlerFoundException.class)
 @ResponseStatus(value=NOT_FOUND)
public org.springframework.web.servlet.ModelAndView handleNoHandlerFoundException(org.springframework.ui.ModelMap model,
                                                                                                                                                                                                             javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request)

        404 Status Errors

        Garbage collects bad URI requests and navigates them to an error page to reflect the issue.

        Parameters:
        model - Session model map
        request - Gives the controller access to the bad URI request to identify
        Returns:
        404 Status error page.
